description:
A certain country in the demon world. The Demon King was defeated by the hands of one of the heroes, and a competition was held for the title of the New Demon King. The Imperial Four Heavenly Kings Vermilio, who is in charge of the tournament, is furious at the participation of the human hero Helck, who is supposed to be her enemy. After receiving news of the fall of the castle of Urum before the final, Vermilio sets out to retake Urum Castle with Helck and other finalists. With a smile, Helck says, "Let's destroy humans." Are those words true? The truth behind the smile is...

Notes:
・The first and second episode premiered at Anime Expo 2023 on July 1. (Source: HIDIVE)
synonyms: ยอดผู้กล้า Helck

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Class Struggle
tags.description: Contains conflict born between the different social classes. Generally between an dominant elite and a suffering oppressed group.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Lost Civilization
tags.description: Featuring a civilization with few ruins or records that exist in present day knowledge.

tags.name: Animals
tags.description: Prominently features animal characters in a leading role.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

alternative: Teppeki no Dorshe (Dorshe the Indestructible‚ 鉄壁のドルーシ)

name.native: ラファエドシャルアミ

node.description: _Note: Not to be confused with the [CG artist](https://anilist.co/staff/156551/)._

[Website](http://www.yoshihisahirano.com/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Hirano_comp)

Studied composing at Juilliard School in 1992, and later at Eastman School of Music. Some of the awards he has received include first prize in the Axia Tape Competition in Japan during his high school years and New York's New Music for Young Ensembles. He has composed music for concert, dance, film and radio with compositions ranging from classical to pop and contemporary music. In recent years he has composed a number of anime soundtracks. He has also made music for Tokyo DisneySea's 2002 and 2004 countdown celebrations.    

Hirano has paired with pianist Masako Hosoda to form the unit Bleu and released two albums. He is also responsible for some of the orchestration and arrangement for a number of Ali Project's albums.

**Height:** 173cm

[Website](https://hiroki773.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hirokinanami773) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hirokinanami773/)

She joined Takarazuka Revue in 2003 and was assigned to *Cosmos Troupe*. In 2015, she was transferred to *Star Troupe*, where she stayed until her resignation in 2019. Her last performance was *ESTRELLAS*.

__[Website](https://saji.tokyo/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/saji_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/saji_staff/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/sajiofficial)__

__Formed:__ December 2010 in Sapporo College of Broadcasting Arts, Music and Dance, Sapporo City, Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan
__Genres:__ Rock, Anison

__Introduction:__
saji is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label King Records (2019–), having previously been under TOY'S FACTORY (2011–2016). They used to go under the name phatmans after school, before changing their name in July 2019.

__Members:__
- [Takumi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/162404/Takumi-Yoshida) (ヨシダタクミ) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Yoshimitsu Yamazaki](https://twitter.com/yoshimitsu_4gen) (ヤマザキヨシミツ) – bassist
- [Shinya Yuutani](https://twitter.com/flying_megane) (ユタニシンヤ) – guitarist

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

A voice actor and musician, notably the lead vocalist and guitarist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Aimi had dreamed of becoming a singer ever since she was young. She initially only aspired to become a singer, but she became interested in voice acting after becoming familiar with the anime series Macross Frontier, where she was impressed at how the series was able to combine music and animation in its storytelling. 

In order to make her dream come true, she participated in various contests, such as the “Best of Singer Contest National Championship 2008”, which she made into the Finals but lost. She was one of 3rd ANIMAX Anison Grand Prix Finalists with Sayaka Sasaki in 2009, and was a winner of the Osaka block. On February 6th, 2010, she made it to the finals of the “Aim for Ellie! Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition”, a seiyuu audition tour hosted by DWANGO Creative School, but lost the role to Mikoi Sasaki. However, she did make her debut as a seiyuu in the Milky Holmes anime.

Aimi was the guitarist of a girls' band in high school and self-taught, but quit playing after graduating. She picked it up back in 2014 and used it to perform during her THE iDOLM@STER Million Live! live performances as Julia. Aimi is the influence and where Kidani Takaaki, the president of Bushiroad, got his idea for the BanG Dream! franchise from - after seeing Aimi playing the guitar during THE IDOLM@STER M@STERS OF IDOL WORLD!! 2014. 

She used her full name for her voice actress career and Aimi (愛美) for her singer career, but she started to use the latter for both since December 2013.

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia)

**Non-Anime Roles**:
- Brünhilde - Azur Lane (VG)
- Mica - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Serval - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Yan - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Cristallo - Reverse: 1999 (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/aimi_sound) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aimin_official/)

Mashiro Shimura is a composer and arranger afilliated with FirstCall.

Mashiro Shimura is a composer and arranger afilliated with FirstCall.

__[Website](http://www.kanoerana.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanoerana7) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kanoerana/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kanoerana) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDKCyrXCr1W4zE-lOw7YBRQ) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@kanoerana)__

__KanoeRana__ is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record labels KABECHORO (2018–) and KURAMAE RECORDS (2019–), having previously been under TAISUKE RECORDS (2015–2016) and Warner Music Japan (2016–2018). She made her first major debut on August 31, 2016, when she released her first mini album titled Kanoe Sanjou.

She currently actively releases small songs and covers to both her twitter and tiktok, which have made her quite renown in recent times.

title.native: 魔入りました！入間くん
バスタード!! 暗黒の破壊神
陰の実力者になりたくて！
骸骨騎士様、只今異世界へお出掛け中
魔王軍最強の魔術師は人間だった
Lv1魔王とワンルーム勇者
Übel Blatt～ユーベルブラット～
